Class CameraController2

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.nineyards.anyline.camera.CameraController

extends CameraController
    Camera controller implementation for camera API 2

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getNewImage

        public AnylineYuvImage getNewImage()
        Specified by:
        getNewImage in class CameraController
        Returns:
        the current image (must be copied immediately, or it may get overridden with a new image) (sets hasNewImage to false until another image is available)

                                   int cropY,
                                   int cropWidth,
                                   int cropHeight,
                                   boolean isGreyOnly)
        Specified by:
        getNewImage in class CameraController
        Returns:
        the next new image cropped to the given size (sets hasNewImage to false until another image is available)

      • getLastImageWithFullSize

        public AnylineImage getLastImageWithFullSize()
        Description copied from class: CameraController

        Get the latest image in full size. This does not check or manipulate CameraController.hasNewImage().

        Prefer CameraController.getLastImageWithFullSizeReceiver(), if you are not sure if the image is actually needed, to save resources.

        Specified by:
        getLastImageWithFullSize in class CameraController
        Returns:
        the latest image in full size.

      • getLastImageWithFullSizeReceiver

        @Nullable
public ImageReceiver getLastImageWithFullSizeReceiver()
        Description copied from class: CameraController

        Get the a receiver for the latest image in full size. This does not check or manipulate CameraController.hasNewImage().

        The receiver does not copy the image if no getter is called.

        Specified by:
        getLastImageWithFullSizeReceiver in class CameraController
        Returns:
        a receiver for the latest image in full size.

      • takeHighResolutionImage

        public void takeHighResolutionImage()
        Description copied from class: CameraController
        Takes a picture from the camera and calls HighResolutionImageListener.onImageTaken(AnylineImage) after the image is taken successfully. If no HighResolutionImageListener is set, the method returns. Additionally, a picture is only taken if the safeToTakePicture flag is set to true, which means the camera is open and preview is started.
        Specified by:
        takeHighResolutionImage in class CameraController

      • callAutoFocus

        public void callAutoFocus()
        Description copied from class: CameraController
        Call auto focus.
        Specified by:
        callAutoFocus in class CameraController

      • openCameraReportError

        public void openCameraReportError()
        Description copied from class: CameraController
        This is called automatically and should usually not be used. Reports opening or error to the CameraOpenListener set with CameraController.setCameraOpenListener(CameraOpenListener).
        Specified by:
        openCameraReportError in class CameraController

      • openCameraInBackground

        public void openCameraInBackground()
        Description copied from class: CameraController
        Open the camera in a background thread, if surface is already created and camera is not opened already. Reports opening or error to the CameraOpenListener set with CameraController.setCameraOpenListener(CameraOpenListener).
        Specified by:
        openCameraInBackground in class CameraController

      • releaseCameraInBackground

        public void releaseCameraInBackground()
        Description copied from class: CameraController

        Release the camera in a background thread. Camera releasing may take a bit, so it may interfere with your exit animation. Use this to do it in the background.

        ALWAYS call this or CameraController.releaseCamera() in onPause of your activity!!

        Specified by:
        releaseCameraInBackground in class CameraController

      • releaseCamera

        public void releaseCamera()
        Description copied from class: CameraController

        Release the camera.

        ALWAYS call this or CameraController.releaseCameraInBackground() in onPause of your activity!!

        Specified by:
        releaseCamera in class CameraController

                             throws java.lang.Exception

                                   android.content.Context context,
                                   @NonNull
                                   android.graphics.RectF cutOutRect,
                                   float surfaceWidth,
                                   float surfaceHeight)
        Description copied from class: CameraController

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        cutOutRect - the cutout rect relative to the surface
